captions.text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I'm getting a little

bit naughty, so what had happened was, someone
challenged me to do a chocolate pound cake

- which wasn't really a challenge - but someone
said 'you know what, I can't believe that

you're almost 900 recipes in and you haven't
done like a basic chocolate pound cake'.
Uh huh!
I see your challenge, I'm going to up you!

I'm going to do a triple chocolate pound cake.
How do you like that!?

So today, that's what we're going to do. We're
going to do a triple chocolate pound cake

that is to die for. When I was making this
recipe just to kid of perfect it and - you

know, I like to test recipes over and over
to perfect them, it was like you - I just

want to eat it. I just wanted the cake in
my face and I wanted to eat it, every bite

of it, and I had to make it over and over
again to make sure it was just perfect enough
to share with you.

So, let me take you over the ingredients you'll
need to make the actual cake and then we'll
do the ganache and the topping.

You're going to need some all purpose flour,
sifted cocoa powder, I've got instant coffee

granules, I've got baking powder, baking soda
and salt. Granulated sugar, lots of butter,

softened at room temperature, eggs, vanilla
extract, whole milk and some sour cream. Those

are the ingredients you're going to need.
Very basic, but they're going to be all together
they make for an amazing pound cake.

I've got my oven pre-heated to 350, I've got
my bundt pan - bundt pan greased with some

non-stick spray, ready to go and I am just
ready to rock and roll, I'm going to make

mine in my standing mixer that I have fitted
with a paddle attachment and it is going to
be so easy, simple, delightful.

To my bowl, I'm going to add my butter. It's
really important that your butter is at room

temperature, mine is even a little bit softer
than room temperature because I had mine on

my stove with the oven pre-heating so it kind
of just melts the edges a little bit, but
no one's judging.

Going to add my sugar, and I'm going to let
this cream together really well, it'll take

a few minutes on medium speed, so let that
go until it's ready.

That looks perfect, I'm just going to take
my spatula and run it along the sides, just

make sure everything is well incorporated,
and now I'm going to add in my eggs along

with a good splash of vanilla extract - if
I can get it opened - there we go.
And then just mix until combined.

Okay, now make sure - I have been coming in
here and just scraping the sides, make sure

you do that because you want to make sure
it's incorporated.

I am going to add my sour cream. Now, sour
cream to me is the ingredient for just the

best pound cake. It gives you just the best
texture, so I think it's important so if you

don't want to use sour cream, you can use
some yogurt, that'll work or you can just
omit the sour cream and just add more milk.
So, you - whichever you want.

I'm going to mix this together just until
it's incorporated, if your batter - it will

start to look clumpy and just kind of odd,
it'll start to look like it's breaking - do

not panic, let that do it's thing, meanwhile
just take a spoon and mix your dry ingredients

together just to get them incorporated and
ready to be added to the wet.

I'm just going to add my dry ingredients - try
not to make a mess like I'm probably going

to, but, my kitchen, my mess I'll clean it
up, do not worry.
Want to get it all in there.

And now, what I'm going to do with my speed
on low, I am just going to drizzle in a little

bit of milk, you might not even need it, it
all depends on humidity, yadda, yadda but

I always find that this batter needs about
a quarter cup of milk and I always use whole
milk.

And then just mix it until you have a really
beautiful velvety smooth batter. But don't

over mix it because you will develop the gluten
and make your pound cake really hard.

Okay, let's get this baby out of here, it's
so gorgeous. It almost looks like a mousse,

it almost looks like ice cream, it just - it's
the most beautiful texture.
Oh I love it.

Okay, just going to get it all off the beater
here because I don't want to really leave

anything behind because the more that's left
behind, the less you're going to get in your

pan, the less you're going to get out of the
pan, the less you're going to be able to eat.

You're seeing where this is going but this
is going to be for me to snack on, do not
worry.

And then as always, I like to take my spatula
and run it around the sides because sometimes
some things just don't get incorporated well.

And now, just put this into your prepared
pan, and we are going to even things out in

just a bit so do not worry - it is a pretty
thick batter because this, again, is a pound

cake it's not going to be a really light crumbly
cake, so you need to expect that it's going

to be a bit of a thicker batter, it's not
going to ooze out, you've just got to give

it a little bit of a push. And then, I just
take my spatula and then all you've got to

do is just run it like so, I - you see how
I'm kind of padding it, that's settling it,

it's settling it into all of these little
grooves of the pan. That's what my nonna taught
me.
My nonna taught me that trick.
Okay, this looks good!

I like to just do a tap tap to make sure it's
all settled and ready to go, and this is going

to go into your oven that you've pre-heated,
or I've pre-heated to 350F and it'll be in

there for about, I would say an hour and ten
minutes, start checking it about around an

hour, but it'll almost need about an hour
and ten minutes, it's a pretty big cake here

so, in it goes and then I'll let it cool completely
and then we'll make a ganache and top it and
it's going to be divine!
Just you wait!

My cake baked for exactly an hour and I've
let it cool completely and I just inverted

it onto a cake plate, and now we are going
to get going on the second component of the

chocolate trifecta here, and it is going to
be my ganache - really easy, really simple,
but really fool-proof every single time.

I've got a small little sauce pan, to it I'm
going to add some heavy cream and I'm going

to bring this to a simmer, I want to get - I
want that to be nice and hot and it's going

to happen really in no time, and then what
I have here are some semisweet chocolate chips,

you could use bittersweet if you want to,
I tend to think bittersweet is a little bit
too um - bitter?

Or you could use milk chocolate chips if you
want to, I sometimes do milk chocolate, semisweet,

it totally depends on my mood, today I'm feeling
a little bit semisweet so I'm going to go

with semisweet chocolate chips, I'm going
to wait for this to come to a simmer and then

we'll put it in and then we'll just keep on
building!

Nice and hot - I'm going to pour my cream
over my chocolate chips and I am not going

to touch it, I'm not going to do anything
to it and let it sit there for about a minute

or two and then once it's had a chance to
sit and settle, we'll give it a good whisk.

Give this a really good whisk after it's been
sitting for just a couple of minutes and melts
the chocolate really perfectly.
That looks great!

See, all melted and it's gorgeous and I love
that, and I'm going to add just a little bit

of butter to it - it's softened at room temperature,
that just gives you really good shine, and
it makes it a little bit richer.
Okay, perfect.

Once it's at room temperature, you can see
it just mixes really, really beautifully.

Now, what I'm going to do is I'm going to
take this baby and I'm going to take my ganache,

which is really nice and thick and I want
it to spill on the sides, which is why I'm

doing it directly on my cake plate and I'm
not doing it onto a different platter because

I like the way it looks when it's spilling
over the sides and it's just - to me - it's
just gorgeous.

And don't you love the kind of stuff that,
like drizzling ganache on your pound cake

that looks chic and amazing but meanwhile
it's like a, it's like a cheat way of wanting

to do it so that you don't have to do anything
strenuous or any decorating, because as we
all know, decorating - not my strong point!
Perfect.

Okay, I'll leave a little bit, eh, I was going
to say I'll leave a little bit behind for
me to snack on, but it's okay. That is perfect.
Oh my goodness.
I mean, that is just gorgeous!

And now, for the third addition to the chocolate,
I need some chocolate shavings - now if you

want to skip the chocolate shavings, what
you can do is you can add some chocolate chips

to the batter and that'll be your third chocolate.
Now, clearly I made a little bit of a boo

boo, and I broke my chocolate bars. But that's
okay!

Because, all is well with the world when you've
got chocolate of any kind, I've got a bittersweet

and I've got a white chocolate, and I take
a really sharp knife, and you can see I have
them on a clean towel, okay?

I like to do this like that and then lean
it close to me so it's kind of like, right
here.

And then take your knife, and then just run
this back like so and I'm doing it the same

time because I want them to mix because I'm
going to put this all over the top and it's
going to look gorgeous!

Ah, I mean this is just - to me - a show stopper!
If I do say so myself.

I really should let this set, but we've met,
we've known each other for about 5 years.

And we know that that's not going to really
happen.
This looks amazing!
Oh, perfection!
Oh, perfection!

Look at that, it's really dense, spongy, and
gorgeous.
Going to go in there like that, hahaha.
Oh my word!
You don't even know.
You don't really know yet.
But you will.
It is so good, I don't even know what to say.

Chocolaty, but believe it or not, not overpoweringly
so, it is just an amazing combination.
That sponge is perfection on every level.

The ganache takes it over the top and the
chocolate on top is just a little flourish

of - like another little kiss of chocolate,
if you will.
It's dynamite!

LauraintheKitchen.com has you covered with
the recipe, I hope you make it, I hope you

love it, thumbs up if you love this recipe,
let me know other chocolate recipes you want

to see because you know I am a self proclaimed
chocoholic and I will bring them to you, as
many of them as you want!

Hope you have enjoyed spending time with me,
here's a bite for you!
I'll see you next time, bye!

title: Triple Chocolate Pound Cake Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 864
